nodes.documentation:
The abstract contract Model defines the whole lifecycle of a debt on the DebtEngine.
Models can be used without previous approbation, this is meant
to avoid centralization on the development of RCN; this implies that not all models are secure.
Models can have back-doors, bugs and they have not guarantee of being autonomous.
The DebtEngine is meant to be the User of this model,
so all the methods with the ability to perform state changes should only be callable by the DebtEngine.
All models should implement the 0xaf498c35 interface.
@author Agustin Aguilar
nodes.name: Model

nodes.documentation: @dev This emits when create a new debt.
nodes.name: Created
ChangedStatus
ChangedObligation
ChangedFrequency

nodes.documentation: @param _timestamp Timestamp of the registry
nodes.name: ChangedDueTime

@param _timestamp Timestamp of the registry
@param _dueTime New dueTime of each installment
nodes.name: ChangedFinalTime

nodes.documentation:
@dev This emits when the call addDebt function.
@param _amount New amount of the debt, old amount plus added

nodes.documentation: @return Identifier of the model

Models can be used without previous approbation, this is meant
to avoid centralization on the development of RCN; this implies that not all models are secure.
Models can have back-doors, bugs and they have not guarantee of being autonomous.
The DebtEngine is meant to be the User of this model,
so all the methods with the ability to perform state changes should only be callable by the DebtEngine.
All models should implement the 0xaf498c35 interface.
@author Agustin Aguilar
nodes.name: Model

nodes.documentation: @dev This emits when create a new debt.
nodes.name: Created
ChangedStatus
ChangedObligation
ChangedFrequency

nodes.documentation: @param _timestamp Timestamp of the registry
nodes.name: ChangedDueTime

nodes.documentation:
@param _timestamp Timestamp of the registry
@param _dueTime New dueTime of each installment
nodes.name: ChangedFinalTime

@dev This emits when the call addDebt function.
@param _amount New amount of the debt, old amount plus added
nodes.name: AddedDebt
AddedPaid

nodes.name: modelId
descriptor
isOperator
validate
getStatus
getPaid
getObligation
getClosingObligation
getDueTime
getFrequency
getInstallments
getFinalTime
getEstimateObligation
create
addPaid
addDebt
run

addDebt(bytes32,uint256).details: This method should only be callable by an operator

params.amount: Debt amount to add to the registry

addDebt(bytes32,uint256).return: added True if the debt was added

addPaid(bytes32,uint256).details: This method should only be callable by an operator

create(bytes32,bytes).details: This method should only be callable by an operator

params.data: Data to construct the new registry
params.id: Id of the registry to create

create(bytes32,bytes).return: success True if the registry was created

descriptor().details: The descriptor contract should follow the ModelDescriptor.sol scheme

getClosingObligation(bytes32).details: This can be a gas-intensive method to call, consider calling the run method before.
getClosingObligation(bytes32).return: amount Amount required to fully paid the loan on the current timestamp

getDueTime(bytes32).return: timestamp The timestamp of the next due time

getFinalTime(bytes32).return: timestamp Timestamp of the final due time

getObligation(bytes32,uint64).details: This can be a gas-intensive method to call, consider calling the run method before.
getObligation(bytes32,uint64).return: amount Amount pending to pay on the given timestampdefined True If the amount returned is fixed and can't change

getPaid(bytes32).details: it should equal to the sum of all real addPaid

getStatus(bytes32).details: This method should always be called by the DebtEngine

isOperator(address).details: Some contracts may check if the DebtEngine is an operator to know if the model is operative or not.

params.operator: Address of the target request operator

isOperator(address).return: True if operator is able to modify the state of the model

run(bytes32).details: If the call had no effect the method would return False, that is no sign of things going wrong, and the call shouldn't be wrapped on a require
run(bytes32).return: effect True if the run performed a change on the state

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Interface identification is specified in ERC-165. This function  uses less than 30,000 gas.

params.interfaceID: The interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165

supportsInterface(bytes4).return: `true` if the contract implements `interfaceID` and  `interfaceID` is not 0xffffffff, `false` otherwise

validate(bytes).details: This method can revert the call or return false, and both meant an invalid data.
validate(bytes).return: True if the data can be used to create a new registry

addDebt(bytes32,uint256).notice: Adds a new amount to be paid on the debt model, each model can handle the addition of more debt freely.

addPaid(bytes32,uint256).notice: If the registry is fully paid on the call and the amount parameter exceeds the required payment amount, the method returns the real amount used on the payment. The payment taken should always be the same as the requested unless the registry is fully paid on the process.

create(bytes32,bytes).notice: Creates a new registry using the provided data and id, it should fail if the id already exists or if calling validate(data) returns false or throws.

descriptor().notice: Returns the address of the contract used as Descriptor of the model

getClosingObligation(bytes32).notice: The amount required to fully paid a registry. All registries should be payable in a single time, even when it has multiple installments. If the registry discounts interest for early payment, those discounts should be taken into account in the returned amount.

getDueTime(bytes32).notice: The timestamp of the next required payment. After this moment, if the payment goal is not met the debt will be considered overdue. The getObligation method can be used to know the required payment on the future timestamp.

getEstimateObligation(bytes32).notice: Similar to getFinalTime returns the expected payment remaining if paid always on the exact dueTime. If the model has no interest discounts for early payments, this method should return the same value as getClosingObligation.

getFinalTime(bytes32).notice: The registry could be paid before or after the date, but the debt will always be considered overdue if paid after this timestamp. This is the estimated final payment date of the debt if it's always paid on each exact dueTime.

getFrequency(bytes32).notice: If the loan has multiple installments returns the duration of each installment in seconds, if the loan has not installments it should return 1.

getInstallments(bytes32).notice: If the loan has multiple installments returns the total of installments, if the loan has not installments it should return 1.

getObligation(bytes32,uint64).notice: If the returned amount does not depend on any interactions and only on the model logic, the defined flag will be True; if the amount is an estimation of the future debt, the flag will be set to False. If timestamp equals the current moment, the defined flag should always be True.

getPaid(bytes32).notice: Returns the total paid amount on the registry.

getStatus(bytes32).notice: Exposes the current status of the registry. The possible values are: 1: Ongoing - The debt is still ongoing and waiting to be paid 2: Paid - The debt is already paid and 4: Error - There was an Error with the registry

isOperator(address).notice: If called for any address with the ability to modify the state of the model registries, this method should return True.

run(bytes32).notice: Runs the internal clock of a registry, this is used to compute the last changes on the state. It can make transactions cheaper by avoiding multiple calculations when calling views. Not all models have internal clocks, a model without an internal clock should always return false. Calls to this method should be possible from any address, multiple calls to run shouldn't affect the internal calculations of the model.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Query if a contract implements an interface

validate(bytes).notice: Validates the data for the creation of a new registry, if returns True the same data should be compatible with the create method.

userdoc.notice: The abstract contract Model defines the whole lifecycle of a debt on the DebtEngine. Models can be used without previous approbation, this is meant to avoid centralization on the development of RCN; this implies that not all models are secure. Models can have back-doors, bugs and they have not guarantee of being autonomous. The DebtEngine is meant to be the User of this model, so all the methods with the ability to perform state changes should only be callable by the DebtEngine. All models should implement the 0xaf498c35 interface.
